DvcAC_nlKaTDsHcA8Slagw.review_text: Finally checked $5 Friday lunch buffet at the Gold Club off my SF bucket list and while my expectations were low, the Gold Club over-delivered in spades!   This was the buffet spread the Friday we were here - fried chicken, BBQ ribs, sandwiches, salads, steamed veggies, mashed potatoes, and desserts. I probably missed a couple of items but you get the gist. I really liked the fried chicken here. For a buffet, my pieces were nice and crispy on the outside but still moist on the inside. I suspect there is a faint dribble of honey in the batter that makes it extra yummy. The ribs, while a little tough, were delicious too. Remember again, this spread is setting you back only your $5 cover. Paired with salad and a brew from the bar, I was a very satisfied diner. Which is interesting when you remember you're not in a restaurant and you notice the ladies with their acrobatic skills in front of you...  ... think of it as a meal and a show. They were truly talented and professional - nothing sleazy at all. In fact, you could almost say it is Cirque du Soleil-esque. That is until you leave the dimness and anonymity of the club and re-enter the brightness & traffic of a Friday afternoon in downtown SF. Good times.

heYprLU4C1-ddsR4BNw7Ig.review_text: This being my FIRST ever Yelp review I thought I'd begin in grand style, with one of my favorite venues in SF. The Gold Club, baby!  They remodeled a few years ago with better seating and décor so it looks more like a classy nightclub than a titty bar. It's a little off the beaten track from the other clubs, which I like. You don't have to deal with the seediness of the Tenderloin or the drunken craziness on Broadway (though that can be fun sometimes).  They're in SOMA, convenient to BART, the mega mall, an a bunch of other places.  Oh, I just found out that they let you in FREE when you flash a convention badge (they're practically next to Moscone Center).  I wish I knew that when I went to Wondercon.   For the most part the girls are all "7" or better. They're a couple "butter faces" and maybe one or two cover models.  But this is coming from me: I'm not incredibly finicky, I like all women.  One of my favorites is Yoko, of Asian persuasion with nice curves and very "hands on."        My last visit was on a Sunday night. It was nice and mellow. I usually sit at one of the tables next to the bar.  Sitting next to the stage hasn't really appealed to me. Sure, it gets you closer to the dancers, but the experience and be hit or miss. Some dancers don't get close to you at all and totally ignore you.   They just added a hanging tapestry for acrobatic acts. I haven't seen one yet. I think only one girl does that right now.  The girls do $20 table dances but I normally get 2 lapdances for $60 in the curtained corner area. The dances aren't done in enclosed booths like Centerfolds.  There's a VIP area upstairs for $10 more. I don't really go up there much. To far from the energy on the main floor. It's cool if you want more privacy with a girl.   Being a topless place they can serve drinks, but they are way overpriced. I paid $7.50 for a Corona. (-1 star) It's what you'd expect from a place like this.  One last thing: bring lots of CASH. You come to places like this to have a good time and that costs $.

M_7cjIKGD3HfQ1G6SyjhkA.review_text: As someone who usually does the take out thing and eats in his office, it's always a nice change to switch things up and have a nice sit-down meal with others--namely Yelpers.  The $5 buffet lunch is one of the best deals you'll ever find anywhere in the FiDi/SOMA area, and definitely makes it very worthwhile even if you don't like to watch topless girls dance around.  The food selection this time around included salad, fried chicken, spare ribs, steamed veggies, and some delicious mashed potaters and yummy cookies.  The crowd was more diverse than I thought it would be--that is to say I expected to see a bunch of old pathetic men.  Instead the crowd here was what you would expect to see at any other establishment in the area, including several groups of just women around.    I'd been in one strip club in my life before this past Friday, and it wasn't a bad experience since we'd had "coupons" for free entrance and lap dances.  So, the idea of paying $60 for a few minutes of having a girl pretend that she likes me didn't appeal a great deal to me.  I can only recommend it for people of similar tastes for the Friday lunch deal, otherwise the strip club connoisseurs can review the rest.  All in all then, Friday was as great a lunch experience as any as I'd ever had before, though I can't give it ***** in part because of a lack of a promised Luis lap dance.  Also a tip, it's extremely dark inside, so be wary when you step outside in the afternoon on a sunny day--it's like staring directly into the sun.

1BuH5Es8d161YjfBmt6cDg.review_text: I had my doubts about the lunch buffet. I went last Friday to honestly try out the fried chicken and chocolate chip cookies everyone was talking about! It was only five dollars, so I wasn't expecting much. Went in, paid 5 bucks (they weren't kidding)! Stood in line for the buffet--the line wasn't that long. The buffet isn't HUGE. There are around 12 items on the table. I didn't get the salad, but I heard it wasn't that great--tastes like store-bought salad.  I grabbed some fried cheese. I didn't know it was fried cheese initially (I thought they were fried tofu, to be vegetarian-friendly, haha). I'm glad I got them because they ended up being my FAVORITE item. The fried chicken was also pretty good. It was very oily, fatty, juicy and tender. Not bad at all. The cookies, however, were disappointing. They are not good at all! Maybe I've been spoiled by all the good cookies I usually get at French and Italian bakeries! But c'mon--I can make better cookies than the ones here. Oh well, I can't complain, keeping in mind that this is a five-dollar buffet. The tiny chocolate thingies were delicious though. I wish I had gotten more of those.  Okay, for those not looking to read about food, but rather the strippers... I wish I had enough experience to review them. I don't because this was my first time at a strip club. Some of the music the club played was a bit weird--didn't match very well with the dancing strippers. For example, I don't think "Super Bass" by Nicki Minaj is exactly appropriate. I don't think the strippers were trying that hard either, they didn't do anything too fancy, except for one. Can't blame them, especially with people concentrating more on the food than them during lunch!

GpZpKakwykH-Gsw-1LpLHg.review_text: I haven't been to a lot of strip clubs in my time but a couple of weeks ago I was required to since I was in a bachelor party. I ended up leaving the club at 2am thinking, "why the f**k don't we come here more often". Now, you may be thinking I was talking about the naked women but that was actually at the very bottom of my list of pros.  Here's a quick breakdown of why I like this place:   * The $20 cover keeps the barrier to entry at a nice level (less crowded).  * The music was freaking fantastic (and no they didn't play U2 all night).  * There was a noticable lack of douchebags (strange for SF on a Saturday).  * There was air conditioning and plenty of seats so it was very comfortable.  * Getting a beer was super easy (the drinks are all $8)  * It wasn't all guy customers, there were girls there as customers as well.  * There were really attractive women dancing. (see, I put this at the bottom of the list!)  Seriously though, I am giving this place five stars because it was one of the easiest nights out in SF in a very long time. Compared to going to Harlot or Slide, this was a breeze and we all had a great time just shooting the shit, while having a few beers.   In the future it'll be very hard to decide to go to a regular club in SF at 11pm on a weekend night, you just know you're going to deal with more hassle than you do at the Gold Club. Nice job Gold Club, you paid attention to the word "club" in "strip-club" and did a great job.

Cons: came here for my birthday, the wife arranged this a as a tradition she does every year. We were greeted with a reasonable cover charge $20 each (women included in case you were wondering). Beyond that there was a gentleman in a nice suit who let us know that it was so busy, that it was bottle service only at a table. Watered Down Drinks: With the gentleman in a suite understanding we'd much rather leave than pay that amount, he made some arrangements to have us seated at a table anyway. We ordered drinks, me a Jameson on the rocks, my wife a red wine, and the couple we were with ordered red wine. I kid you not, the drinks were watered down to the point that the red wine looked more like Kool-aid than what they were advertising for $8. This didn't discourage our friends, who ordered another red wine and happened to fine a piece of what I'd like to think was cork, but given the dim, highly colored lights, we literally couldn't see what it was. The main stage strip dances are borderline burlesque: The girls go on stage, do one song fully clothed, then do another song fully clothed, then on the third song, they, no joke, will take their top off for about the last 20-30 seconds of the show. Every strip club I've ever been to has been $20 for a lap dance that lasts 1-1.5 songs and is off in a separate more private area so this was definitely not a welcome chance of pace.  The worst part of the strip club was actually not their fault but the laws of California. For that I won't take any stars away but it bears mentioning. The first is obviously the fact that strip clubs in CA aren't fully nude (this is common in many states though). Some states have ways around this by not serving alcohol, I'm not sure if there are any fully nude dry strip clubs in SF though. The other more obscure law that is the most f-ed up thing I've ever heard of is California's 6-foot rule. This means that if it's a club where alcohol is served a dancer is prohibited from being closer than 6 feet from a patron once her top is removed (I don't know how this law applies to lap dances). This means that if you like a dancer and want to go sit up by the stage, the dancer will not only not give you any personal attention if you've got a stack of ones handy, but she'll actually move away from you once you come and sit by the stage. How do they make tips you might be asking? Well lap dances aside, people just take their money, walk up to the stage and throw the money on the stage and then walk back to their seat. If this isn't the most ass backwards rules in Otrip club history then I don't know what is. Forget prop 19, they really need to do something about this.  Overall it was a nice club, just get cash before hand, come during the day for a nearly free admission, and keep the messed up laws in mind.

Well, too bad, because it's awesome, and we're all just trying to tell everyone to let them know that this is the best Friday lunch deal in town! For the price of a Subway footlong, you get entry to probably the most "high - end" strip club in the city, and a motherfucking buffet with motherfucking coconut shrimp. And tons of other stuff. They had fish and chips, roast beef, salad, brownies, all that. That'll leave you enough to get a $10 cocktail! Which, for a strip club, isn't that bad. (This was the daytime shift, so I'm sure the scenery and  lineup is subject to change.) Overall, some really hot girls, none of whom looked extremely plastic-y or anything. Most of them could work the pole pretty well, too!   The club itself is pretty big. The decor is nice, sleek, and modern, which is different from the strip clubs I'm used to going to in SF hahaha! The ambiance is classier than most, but it is SO dark in there! Seriously, I almost bumped into a bunch of people on my way to the bathroom. (They're pretty nice for a strip club, too.)  Overall, I really dug the Gold Club. The buffet is a great deal, although I think at regular hours, it's 20 or so bucks to get in, which is kind of standard for a lot of clubs in the city. Anyways, if you're looking for a dirty, explicit show, tons of contact, and beaver in your face, then this isn't the place for you, but if you're looking for some hot girls in a non - sketchy atmosphere (it's the only strip club in SF that's not either in NB or the TL) then come on down to the Gold Club, and remember to tip your hardworking dancers!

eKUGKQRE-Ywi5dY55_zChg.review_text: Girls like to "Make It Rain" too!  Every time I mention that I want to go to the Strip Club, I always get the "WTF?!?!?" look from my friends especially from my guy friends. I don't get it, what's wrong with wanting to appreciate another pretty girl?!?!? Anyhow, I digress.   Two weeks ago, during our normal Friday night debauchery at a nearby club, I mention to my friends that I wanted to go to Gold's Club. It was no surprise that I got the usual, "Are you serious?" look but they agreed (alkie makes it so much easier).  On Friday, October 29, 2010, my friends and I (guys and girls) went to GC a little before midnight.   You have to excuse my knack for details as I walked into GC after 4 LC's and a beer, so I was a bit inebriated to say the least.    COVER:  $10 for guys and girls.  DRINKS: I spent $10 on ONE beer! Seriously?!?!? Oh yah, the waitresses will swoop up you drinks before 1:45 AM, so you better chug your drinks by then.  STAFF: Professional and friendly for the most part. However, when my friend had her foot resting on the stage after "Making it Rain", the bouncer who told her to keep her feet off the stage was rude about it.  "THE LADIES": I was NOT impressed at all. I remember seeing about 5 or so dancers and most seemed stone cold and didn't really seem to have any interest in what they were doing. If you want people to "Make it Rain", at least FAKE IT!  The worst part is 4 of the 5 girls were NOT even remotely attractive and had absolutely NO T&A. BOO!!!  CROWD: More upscale mixed crowd than your usual sleaze bags you see at the Strip Clubs on Broadway.   MUSIC: Hip-Hop, R&B, and Pop.   AMBIANCE/DÉCOR: GC is the classiest and cleanest multi-level Strip Club in SF. Like I said, I can't remember all the exact details, but I do remember the sexy dim lighting, plushy chairs, and dark purple décor and gold accents. There are two bars; one at the main floor and one in the VIP area upstairs.   My biggest gripe is we couldn't find the women's restroom. Every time we thought we found the restroom it was the men's restroom. Seeing how frustrated we were, one of the employees said we could use the men's restroom.   PARKING: Street parking can be difficult; however, it isn't hard to come by before 10 PM. They also offer valet parking.   I doubt I would ever return to GC again (not even for the $5 lunch buffet) b/c I can simply open my closet door and pull out my ironing board if I wanted to look at something flat. Sorry...

Xnps7YMe83xnX0IoUwRacA.review_text: The Gold Club has become a Friday lunchtime favorite of me and my community of Yelping techie/marketing drones. We've been enjoying our times here the last couple of months but lately a few things we've been noticing. A lot of the great dancers are disappearing! After talking to some of the gals there it seems that Friday is not the best day to work. Guys come and eat but don't tip to well or don't want to be bothered while they gnaw on their chicken (moist and tasty) and tacquitos. Are the dancers hiding out downstairs until they clear the buffet?  Another thing to watch out for. The daytime cocktail waitresses aren't very pleasant and will rip you off if your not paying attention. A classic example is they don't have change for your drink order. Now, this is an important part of cocktailing, taking drink orders, delivering the drink and carrying enough change to carry out simple transactions. Twice we have had a waitress say they will bring back the change then never come back. You then have to chase them down to get your change. Another example is you get a $3 Coke and they will try and offer you less than normal change - your distracted, there's loud music and your looking at some dancer on stage and they hope you just say 'yes'. 8kqVJlimuYWNKCMP4r3w_Q.review_text: I don't always take cabs around the city, but when I do, it's to make it on time to a $5 all you can eat lunch buffet at a strip club.  *FOOD* Expectations:  - All around mediocrity that hopefully won't give me food poisoning - The much raved about fried chicken is basically KFC in sexier ambiance covered in sexier looking grease  Reality:  - My tastebuds are pretty much racist against all fried foods because to me they all taste more or less the same. That said, I'm pretty sure Gold Club's fried chicken is coated in half batter and half unicorn magic. I got myself 3 FULL PLATES of just fried chicken wings and that's not just because I'm cheap and wanna load up on my $5 worth. - Speaking of getting my $5 worth, I easily did that with the first scoop of fruits. I mean, one sad ass cup of fruits in this costly hippies playground of SF is $5 (what the hell am I doing in this Dilbert's cube, I wanna be a fruit farmer) - Selection otherwise was small as expected, but everything was at least above frozen meal quality. There was some braised unknown meat next to the fried chicken that tasted pretty legit, along with the cookies. The churros would've been better if they weren't filled with some mysterious jizz tasting thing.  *SHOW* Expectations: - Something closer to a zoo  Reality: - Hot girls, a lot of 8s and there might've been a 10/10 ginger unicorn. - Every one of the girls could move like spiderman, half of them literally climbed like 20 ft up the pole and just chilled there like we were in zero gravity. I basically have zero chance trying out for a gig at this R-rated cirque du soleil so I just watched and ate my fried chicken.  *OTHER TIPS* - Any beverage (including water) you order to down the chicken and re-hydrate post-drools is an extra few bucks. Not a big deal since overall you still get much more than you pay for, or you can just be cheap and get a free drink afterwards from one of the million startups around the corner (what I did, at least I tipped on the meal) - Lunch buffet is every weekday from 11:30AM to 2PM. 1 hour of lunch and show is actually more than enough time to enjoy your break. And I probably didn't need to tell my cab driver I'm in a rush to get to a strip club by 1.  Gold Club has easily become one of my fave weekday lunch spots in the city. I will be that one fully-dressed chick regularly sitting off stage with two plates of fried chicken.  (Don't ask me if my name is Emily. My name is not Emily. I'm fully-dressed with two plates of fried chicken and no acrobatic moves.)

WQK2vRyInvMcfQSUCY460Q.review_text: All I can say is wow, I'm impressed.   I've been here thus far on two occasions. The first was for a friend's birthday. It was a weekend and after bar hopping, we thought it would be entertaining to go to a stripclub. The cover fee was $20, which I thought was a bit steep, so it had better been a good show or I'd been quite bitter. Surprisingly, my stingy bottom was ultimately impressed. The girls were all so fit and acrobatic that even for a heterosexual female, the show was utterly entertaining. I was also impressed by the number of performers and variety between each girl, it seemed like there was a girl to cater to almost every taste. Needless to say, found a greater appreciation for strippers after this night.   Months later, a friend of mine came across the reviews for this club on Yelp. We were all amused that this club seemed to be famous for their afternoon show/buffet on weekdays. Also, it was only $5. I was almost speechless, this had to be too good to be true, so of course I went to check it out. After going on a Friday, which is known for their fried chicken lunch (which all the Yelpers are raving about), I became a believer. First of all, it was a full house, on a weekday afternoon, impressive. Second of all, the show was still of great quality, decently young women who were still impressively acrobatic. Third, the food was of pretty good standard. How is this possible. For $5, the buffet included a DIY salad bar, fresh cut fruit, a protein dish, fried chicken, a pasta dish, a side of garlic bread and a small selection of pastries. Since this club is located near the financial, I saw a handful of people coming for their lunch breaks. And I completely understand why.  Heck, I would have easily paid $5 alone for the fruit in the area. I guess I too have found my new lunch spot.

oAlP03cHvPZrEgqWDdYAAw.review_text: No, I don't like Tit-Tays... But I do love me some FRIED CHICKEN TIT-TAYS!!!   For those that don't know, every Friday they have a $5 lunch buffet. I believe its from 11:30am-2pm. You actually get a lot for $5 -food, cover, and boobies! Sorry fellaz, lap dances are sold separately. I know it may sound weird to eat and have strippers dancing it front of you. But really, its not that bad! I mean, at least they're not FULLY nude! Now that would totally make me lose my appetite! And plus, the strippers don't bother you when you're eating.  Speaking of food. For $5, its totally worth it! The only reason why I came here was to try their fried chicken. I heard they had good fried chicken and wanted to see for myself. I thought it was just okay. A little too crispy for me. Not enough meat and too much skin. Too bad they didn't have any hot sauce. Next time I'll bring my own. They also had steamed vegetables, hummus and pita breads, salad, pasta, steamed vegetables, this beef dish, fruit and dessert. OMFG, their brownies were delicious! That totally made my day! Despite ordering a Malibu pineapple for almost  $9.  As for the strippers...some of them were pretty cute. This is actually my second time going to a strip club. I thought the strippers here were much cuter and talented than the ones at Center Folds. Just sayin. Watch out for Keilani and Lily. They REALLY know how to work that pole!   Btw, my friend told me there was an attendant at the men's room. Be nice to him. He makes sure you don't smell like stripper when you go home.  I also have to mention their ladies room was also clean. The entire place seemed pretty clean. Being a germophobe, I kept waiting for someone to wipe down the pole. I only saw one stripper do it  (which was Keilani). Good job girlfriend!  haha.  Thanks Gold Club for waking me up from my 5 month Yelp slumber. I'll definitely be back when I have another Friday off. ;)

Lights and sparkles, closed off access to the outside world, the smell of baby powder all over, and glamorous paintings on the wall.  It makes for a perfect ambiance for a delightful meal.    And which meal might that be?  a FIVE DOLLAR Friday Lunch Buffet.  Where else can you find a buffet meal for $5.  They had fruits, cakes, curry pork, fried chicken, and steamed vegetables.  Hey, for $5, that's pretty good already.  The curry pork was surprisingly tender and tasty.  The the fried chicken was crisp and meaty. QjkYh8mqH43UkG51e58bUA.review_text: I've never been to a strip club on a Monday afternoon. I've also never been to a strip club just for the food either lol! I heard good things about the buffet but didn't believe it at first. After eating here, my mind has changed. I didn't have high expectations coming in but left feeling good about my visit.  The buffet itself is free but there is a $5 cover charge to get into the club. When I went inside, I was actually surprised that it was not filthy and actually pretty clean. There's plenty of lounge chairs and some round tables so you can eat.  The food is delicious! There was salad, ham sandwiches, and desserts. However, like others have said, the chicken is where it's at. The skin isn't too fried and the chicken is not too salty. The meat itself is tender and not too chewy. Unlike other clubs, alcohol is served (at least during lunch hour)! The beers are priced at around $7 which is pretty pricey but expected.  The dancers were pretty impressive. They performed pole moves that actually look hard to do and would need some practice. It was entertaining and certainly brings a different experience to the usual dining experience.   My only negative is that our waitress demanded a tip. I didn't really wanna give her one but gave her $1 just to be nice.  All in all: Strippers + Great Chicken = 4 Stars!

2uM3O9Qy4vxvITAfke7_4g.review_text: Yes, I'm a hetreosexual girl and I went with my friends to the Gold Club. Why? Just for fun! Seriously people, girls can also enjoy going to the Gold Club. Yes, we were asked for "private time" several times by the Gold Club girls. But others understood that we were there just to have fun and started talking to us as "one of us". Yes, the girls are very nice and friendly. Not trashy at all! They have class.  The buffet, don't expect too much, but I assume most people who go to the Gold Club don't really go there for the food. I'm not saying it is not good, cause the food they serve is pretty tasty (I mean, it's free!), but the diversity of the food is very little (4 different kinds of dishes). But then again, it's free!  The drinks are really good ($4 during the entire day, until 7PM) with a good amount of alcohol in there (no, they are not cheap, just because it is happy hour!).  Honestly, I had my doubts before I went here, but it's really worth it and very classy! Girls (& guys of course too!) just go here with a group of girls and have fun! You'll have a nice evening with your girls. And if not, well, it was only $5 to get in!

NSPc5WAzKjQr2D3SiFAeXg.review_text: 3.5 stars, rounded up.  Mostly because you get a lot of bang and boobs for your buck.  Five bucks to be exact.    I was actually doing an extensive search for fried chicken in SF when I found the reviews for Gold Club.  I read some accounts and decided that I needed to hit up this place for:  1. Fried chicken 2. The ladies  And that's in order of importance.  And seriously, what a STELLAR COMBINATION, right?  Buffet + strip show?  And we're not even in Vegas? That's right!  $5 cover on Fridays between 11:30am-2:00pm gets you a free lunch buffet.  And the beautiful girls, of course.  On the day I went, they had fried chicken, roast beef with some type of nasty horseradish sauce, a mixed greens salad, fruit (whole apples, and sliced up pineapple, strawberries, watermelon, melon), and cookies.  The food was just alright.  To my extreme horror, the fried chicken was not especially tasty - bland and boring!  My cookie was also burnt, but I liked it that way.    We got to sit upstairs in the lounge area with tables, and the space was pretty comfortable.  We had a good view of the stage and the ladies.  For some reason though, I felt like the show was pretty tame.  I guess I was expecting fireworks or full nudity or something outrageous, but maybe because it was the middle of the day on a weekday, so maybe that's why the ladies and general vibe was a bit more mellow and toned down?    But anyway, overall I thought it was pretty awesome that for $5, you can get unlimited food (albeit, the food's not that great) and a topless strip show.  The crowd was also pretty mixed, and we saw some groups of women there for lunch too.    Heh, if you work downtown, it's definitely something different than your run-of-the-mill FiDi/SoMA/Downtown lunch spots.  And for that, it gets that extra 0.5 stars just for being differently awesome and awesomely different.

ESSJ0nUc2hYSWKSwft4nlw.review_text: I was a strip club virgin before going to the Gold Club. I had no idea what the strip club etiquette was for tipping, where I was sitting, etc... I love this place, it absolutely obliterated any previous impression of what strip clubs are like thanks to any/all made for TV movies featuring the "seedy strip club" and it's parade of scary ladies.  The Gold Club is not the image of some sticky floored, smoky, titty bar that Hollywood has burned into our (my) consciousness. Nay, it is powder smelling, ambient (yeah, I was there early-ish so it was still crowd free), cozy, clean and comfortable.  The dancers vary from the sleepy slow rollers on the verge of a yawn to the gymnasts who slink up the poll in the middle of the stage and shimmy down, showcasing their athletic prowess and outstanding sex appeal. The ladies are all attractive and I would imagine any male patron (and probably a lot of females as well) will find a young lady to their liking. I can't tell you how many times I turned to another woman sitting near me and said "I really need to work out" because the ladies here have sick bodies. Total inspiration to order P90X or cough up the cash for a gym membership. But I digress...The drinks are around $9ish but thankfully my male cohorts had me covered in that arena so who am I to complain? I understand that the food is good and the friday lunch is a great deal. And as a bonus, getting there early-ish got me in free.  No longer a virgin to the strip club scene, I have done my google searching on strip club etiquette and now feel totally prepared to tip like nobody's business. UHgXmu7hl-o078IW_Fp4dg.review_text:
if a stripclub falls into oblivion does it make a sound?   yes, a huge sucking sound.  as with most strip clubs, the gold club has had some management changes over the years and unfortunately they've all been for the worse.
  this used to be a great after work spot on fridays when the cover charge($25) was waived before 7pm.  roll up out of work downtown, meet your boys at 4:30p, find a good table near the stage but not TOO near the stage, and throw back $4.25 pints of microbrews.  best deal in town.  if you have some tact and know what's up you can get away with firing a doobie in the smoking cube.  old dj dave used to drop some dope grinds and he'd always have a minute to tell you what albums he was into.  
  oh, that's right, they also gots the nekkid ladies up in here.  the talent used to drip from the walls and the 7pm grand showcase was primo.  all the day shift girls and all the night shift girls would converge on-stage for an introduction and a few catwalk turns and then descend on the crowd for 2-for-1 lapdances.  that was not only the best part of the night but also your cue to leave because happy hour just ended.  
  nowadays, the worst girl from the golden era is the best girl in the place.  there is no more 'happy hour' entrance fee waiver.  the whole place is overrun with yahoo hardhats from local construction spots who still wear their toolbelt(s).  the only people wearing tool belts in a strip club should be named Kandy or Tiffani or Sapphyre.  save your money to buy a real girl a drink and relish the only good thing left from the gold club, your memories.

CEILDepAbTQqBcYz_vDfyA.review_text: So, the last time I was in a strip club I was dragged by my straighty girlfriend/roommate to go see Heather Hunter pop it, bend it over, and slide all around it... at a janky Tenderloin place with Chewy Gomez (from the radio) introducing the ladies as I sat at a table in the back with my bag of to-go Indian food... Afterward, we went back stage and got a poloroid picture with Heather (which my roommate used as her Christmas card that year). who my roommate later called 'Wholesome.' She was quite sweet and engaging actually, but we were at a strip club, and though my experience in this venture has not been by any means vast, it seems pretty much a no brainier that a girl stripping for your money is going to be nice to you.  Now, how does this relate to the Gold Club, you're asking yourself? Well, if you've read this far, stick with me.  Fast-forward 10? years, and I'm sitting at my desk at work minding my own business, when my straighty female co-worker says to me, "Hey, you have to come with me to the Gold Club for lunch and my gay friend Nathan's birthday." I say, sure, fine, cause I've heard there's an all you can eat friend chicken buffet for $5, which is sounding just about right for my budget AND I like gays!  After being carded and paying our $5, we enter the club. It's like walking into a set for a movie that takes place in a strip club. You've seen the movie, and now you can go there in person, but, in the center of the club is a group of about 20 gay guys, with a few lesbians and straighty girls peppered in, eating lunch and watching a chick work the stripper pole on stage. Every time the girl would perform some super human acrobatic feat, the group would erupt in applause and cat calls.  The buffet was great for $5. Let's be real, it's not Las Vegas or even Princess Cruises, but it's better than Lee's, and when was the last time you got out of Lee's for under $6.00? And Lee's certainly doesn't have an atmosphere that comes anywhere near the Gold Club's. So, the Gold Club is a WIN, and Lee's is NOT.  Now, the stripper pole.... I know, you've been waiting for this part and your patience is about to be rewarded. I give the stripper pole a good 5 stars all on it's own, This pole reaches up 2 full stories, and these girls are NOT afraid to climb it to the top.... And an extra star to the girl who came out and wiped the pole down before beginning her routine.... Know that your attention to detail was surely appreciated!  The only BOOOOOOO is the $3.00 ice tea I ordered that came in a small plastic cup and was mostly ice. Now, I don't mind that it cost me almost as much as the meal and admission, but don't go skimpy on me! I know you're trying to make up for the cheap meal, but it's ice tea. Giving me 3 times as much in an actual glass isn't going to effect your profit margin, believe me. But, I wasn't surprised so it's not enough for me to grade down for it.  I do wonder if it's a requirement that all the girls wear the clear see-thru-plastic platform pumps...   Now, don't be confused. There are some straight guys that come to the GC on a Friday for lunch and a few of the really awkward ones will straggle up to the stage and sit down staring googly eyed at the jiggling bits of the girls dancing on stage as they toss out dollar upon dollar. Of course you sit there and wonder how they don't see the true point of the place or appreciate the artistic nature of the girls' performances, but it makes the girls more money and they don't seem to mind so you can kind of forgive it. But it is a little weird to watch, truth be told.  Will I go back? Yes, but I hope it's full of gay men again hootin and hollerin for girls doing crazy acrobatic pole tricks!!

iLjMdZi0Tm7DQxX1C1_2dg.review_text: Would you like your ass with a side of CLASS? Well, Gold Club just might be calling your name! Talk about a winning combination... spicy tuna rolls, quesadillas and hamburgers, coupled with upscale "performance art" and a full bar? Win, win, win!  The interior is very clean and leaves zero room for grimy vibrations. Nice lighting, friendly staff and an above-average array of Tuesday afternoon entertainers. When you roll through for lunch, cover is a fat goose egg... so you get a lot of bang-for-your-buck, so to speak.  I didn't have an opportunity to revisit the location after the sun went down, but I can imagine it only gets better from here.  Being that this fleshy display of greatness is a little on the steep side... it's not for everybody. I'm a firm believer in the anecdote, "you get what you pay for," however, so I didn't mind shelling a few extra duckets for quality. If you're shopping for copper, I wouldn't recommend you blow your two-week paycheck at Gold Club. If you're looking to peel a dimer and have some expendable cash flow at your disposal, you've just hit the Emerald City.

BOU25_BWQnLdFJBKUe2XdQ.review_text: Came in here for their $5 buffet. So I got here a little after 11:30am, paid the $5 cover and was seated next to the stage. The buffet was next to the bar. I think they are pointless, silly and a big waist of money (and self esteem).  But, when the rest of the group wanted to go to the Gold Club because the bar we were planning on going to sucked, I had to go along with the group.  I begrudgingly paid my $20 entrance fee and ordered my first of two overly priced watered down drinks.  We were greeted by the standard wave of scantily clad women at the door, smiling in a way that makes you feel as if you actually have a shot with one of them... Girls of course who are only working in such a place to put themselves through law school.  While these girls were your typical mixture of woman, a type for a variety of tastes, I was quite surprised to see the quality of girl on stage.  I don't really want to get into a review of the women working here because i feel like it would be far too demeaning and chauvinistic.  I will say that  I remember feeling bad for one girl who was on stage and all the men in the front row got up in the middle of her act and left, not having thrown down or stuffed a single dollar into her sparkly g-string.  I almost wanted to toss some money onto the stage to make her feel a little better, but I didn't. gJIrVsi1sIDEAbonTm6T9w.review_text: Wow.  Where to even begin?  This is simply a world-class establishment. The interior is elegant yet casual, offering guests the perfect setting for all of their entertaining needs, whether it be courting potential business clients or trying to cultivate a relationship with a talented young lady.  The staff is remarkably professional and organized, all the while maintaining a relaxed, hospitable demeanor , making for a truly pleasurable environment for guests.  On average, the girls here are certainly on a higher level than any other club in the city, and every other club i have frequented for that matter.  Not that every girl in here is a dimepiece, but there really aren't any girls that make you think "Yikes, who gave this bitch a job?".... at least not on night shift.   In addition to the girls, ambiance and stellar service, the food is worth coming for as well.  Overall, I highly recommend this joint, especially to visiting businessmen and anyone trying to celebrate a special occasion.    Shout out to all my bitches gettin their paper in here.

t2innmXNNrkA_Y2jfFIaxg.review_text: I first stumbled onto Gold Club on a day when I wandered by and noticed they had a sign out front of a free daily buffet. Legit. That blew me a way; how cool is the idea of boobs and chicken wings? I had a few opportunities to meet a few of the strippers outside the club and engage them in conversation - really nice and entertaining ladies. I discussed things with my wife as they went along and asked if she would be interested in joining me for an evening to check out the club. She was cool (cause she is straight awesome), and away we went. I reserved dinner for us on a Friday night and it was on!   First thing is that when I say "reserved dinner", I mean it! They seated us and broke out a table cloth and handed menus with a lot of GREAT meals. Very high class cool stuff. The wife and I greatly enjoyed our meals (and our adult beverages) while watching women writhe on stage. Something I would have never imagined could be so fun! The women in gold club are fantastic to look at, watch dance, and talk to! They will sit with you and talk and not just hustle for a dance and leave. Tons of fun! They also don't seem to be afraid of a woman being with you; in fact they make it a point to offer a dance for the wife each time. No problem for me! Such a phenomenal time; the wife also had a great time that she probably never imagined! I am so proud to be married to such an amazing woman - and thanks to her I got to have  (and may continue to get to have) a wonderful time in a wild environment that appeals to my ADD best!!     Do yourself a favor. This is the ONLY strip club in town if you want to have a great time and some nudity. If you are all about dances and boobs only - still a good spot I would imagine. Go!

Y3QU8Jj3lYuVa2LmunvnRg.review_text: Came here for lunchbox Friday on one of the hottest days of the year in one of the few cities where local businesses don't have to have A.C. Um, yeah... It was hotter than a stripper's butt crack in there.   Food wise. Nothing to go out of your way for. Some fried chicken, some fried cheese and some cut fruit. No drink specials.   And just like almost every other regular strip club in the world, this interior of this place was just tacky.   It was so hot that the dancers were hardly  dancing. Their dancing was more like slow movements with fast hand-fanning movements. But since it was so hot in there, I kinda wished I were a scantily clad as the strippers.   I might be back. Not for Lunchbox Friday's though. No thanks.
